pixi.core.sprites.Sprite

type
class
extends
pixi.core.display.Container
subclasses
pixi.core.text.Text, pixi.extras.MovieClip, pixi.extras.TilingSprite
metadata
:native
"PIXI.Sprite"

Static Methods

fromFrame(frameId : String) : Sprite

parameters
frameId {String} The frame Id of the texture in the cache
returns
{Sprite} A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the frameId
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture from the TextureCache based on the frameId The frame ids are created when a Texture packer file has been loaded

fromImage(imageId : String, ?crossorigin : Bool, ?scaleMode : Int) : Sprite

parameters
imageId {String} The image url of the texture
returns
{Sprite} A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the image id
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture based on an image url If the image is not in the texture cache it will be loaded

Constructor

new(texture : pixi.core.textures.Texture)
parameters
texture {Texture} The texture for this sprite
The Sprite object is the base for all textured objects that are rendered to the screen A sprite can be created directly from an image like this: ```js var sprite = new Sprite.fromImage('assets/image.png'); ```

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

alpha : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The opacity of the object.

anchor : pixi.core.math.Point

The anchor sets the origin point of the texture. The default is 0,0 this means the texture's origin is the top left Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right corner

blendMode : Int

The blend mode to be applied to the sprite. Set to CONST.blendModes.NORMAL to remove any blend mode.

buttonMode : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Indicates if the displayObject uses button mode or normal mode.

cacheAsBitmap : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Set this to true if you want this display object to be cached as a bitmap. This basically takes a snap shot of the display object as it is at that moment. It can provide a performance benefit for complex static displayObjects. To remove simply set this property to 'null'

children : Array<DisplayObject>

inherited from pixi.core.display.Container
The array of children of this container.

defaultCursor : String

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Default cursor.

filterArea : pixi.core.math.shapes.Rectangle

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The area the filter is applied to. This is used as more of an optimisation rather than figuring out the dimensions of the displayObject each frame you can set this rectangle

filters : Array<Dynamic>

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Sets the filters for the displayObject. * IMPORTANT: This is a webGL only feature and will be ignored by the canvas renderer. To remove filters simply set this property to 'null'

height : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.Container
The height of the Container, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

interactive : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Indicates if the displayObject is interactive or not.

interactiveChildren : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Indicates if the children of displayObject are interactive or not.

mask : pixi.core.graphics.Graphics

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Sets a mask for the displayObject. A mask is an object that limits the visibility of an object to the shape of the mask applied to it. In PIXI a regular mask must be a PIXI.Graphics object. This allows for much faster masking in canvas as it utilises shape clipping. To remove a mask, set this property to null.

name : String

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The instance name of the object.

parent : Container

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The display object container that contains this display object.

pivot : pixi.core.math.Point

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The pivot point of the displayObject that it rotates around

position : pixi.core.math.Point

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

renderable : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Can this object be rendered, if false the object will not be drawn but the updateTransform methods will still be called.

rotation : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The rotation of the object in radians.

scale : pixi.core.math.Point

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The scale factor of the object.

shader : Dynamic

The shader that will be used to render the sprite. Set to null to remove a current shader.

texture : pixi.core.textures.Texture

The height of the sprite, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

tint : Int

The tint applied to the sprite. This is a hex value. A value of 0xFFFFFF will remove any tint effect.

visible : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The visibility of the object. If false the object will not be drawn, and the updateTransform function will not be called.

width : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.Container
The width of the Container, setting this will actually modify the scale to achieve the value set

worldAlpha : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The multiplied alpha of the displayObject

worldTransform : pixi.core.math.Matrix

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Current transform of the object based on world (parent) factors

worldVisible : Bool

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
Indicates if the displayObject is globally visible.

x : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The position of the displayObject on the x axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

y : Float

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
The position of the displayObject on the y axis relative to the local coordinates of the parent.

generateTexture(renderer : pixi.core.renderers.webgl.WebGLRenderer, ?resolution : Float, ?scaleMode : Int) : pixi.core.textures.Texture

inherited from pixi.core.display.DisplayObject
parameters
renderer {CanvasRenderer|WebGLRenderer} The renderer used to generate the texture.
resolution {Number} The resolution of the texture being generated
scaleMode {Number} See {@link SCALE_MODES} for possible values
returns
{Texture} a texture of the display object
Useful function that returns a texture of the display object that can then be used to create sprites This can be quite useful if your displayObject is static / complicated and needs to be reused multiple times.
